Events that occurred on 26 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1915 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 3.
1941 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 46.
1956 - The second episode of 1956 radio series of The Lord of the Rings airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1963 – J.R.R. Tolkien, James Dundas-Grant, Robert Havard, Owen Barfield and Christopher Tolkien attend the funeral of C.S. Lewis.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 251.
1964 - The 1964 BBC Interview with J.R.R. Tolkien was made.
1974 - Bilbo's Last Song is published as a poster.
1982 - Tom Shippey published "Blunt Belligerence", a review of Mr. Bliss, The Times Literary Supplement.
1984 - The Book of Lost Tales Part Two is published in the US.
2003 - Actor Gordon Reid dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
New moon[1]

content.content: ↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xlviii
